title: Simon Tatham is a hero
comment: A fantastic collection. All playable offline. Puzzles generated from customisable settings. All completely free with no adverts. Considerable documentation for each game. Simon Tatham is a hero here and the only thing missing is a "donate" button! Lots of credit also goes to Chris Boyle for this Android port.
If you want a sharper brain, download this now!

title: Recent issues
comment: Ah the dead space is a hardware issue, it's just in this app that it's noticeable. Thanks for the quick response, back to five stars for me!

Thanks, this is news to me - could you try phone settings / Developer options / Pointer location (halfway down) & see if you can draw smoothly through that area? That should rule out a broken screen. If so, drop me an email, I'll send you links to some old versions and we can hopefully establish where the trouble started.

title: Prefect brain games
comment: If more people played these games than watched reality TV or fought in wars the earth would be a better place.
Amazing

Loved it! I've really enjoyed this up until today! Suddenly the colours are all changed, backgrounds all black. What has gone wrong? I really don't want to lose this one!    ...      Half hour later ... Really prompt help, thank you, it's just the night mode. All sorted!
This is the new night mode. By default it comes on in low light, but there's a setting for it (e.g. you can set always off).
Thank you for the nice puzzles! And no adds.

title: Best game(s) ever

title: Best app ever!

title: Challenging but very fun

title: Great games
comment: Great games, great variety. Only 4 stars because I don't like giving apps unnecessary permissions, and this one wanted access to my media (?) in a recent update. Uninstalled it on principal, when that happened - I'm sure the app isn't malicious, I'm just paranoid.

The media permission is for saving games to SD card, and the NFC permission is for Android Beam to send a game to a friend's phone (source is on github if anyone wants to check). If your device allows, you can revoke them and not use those features. The next version of Android (MNC) lets you do that and lets me only ask for them when needed.

No Adds, works without being connected to the net, and lots of puzzles.  You can sort your favorites to the top of the list so you don't need to  search through the alphabetized list to find the one the currently has all of your attention.  Thanks for making this available :)

title: Excellent!
comment: Excellent quality puzzles that are and do exactly what they're supposed to. Play offline, keep your mind sharp and challenge your friends with this incredible collection of games.

title: Best puzzles app!
comment: No ads whatsoever, and over time the interface for some of the puzzles has been significantly improved. And a huge selection of puzzles. All in all one of the greatest apps for puzzle lovers there is at the moment I think =)

title: Basically perfect!

comment: Contains a plethora of logic and math puzzles including a sudoku clone that tops all the commercial products I've tried. All the puzzles are generated so you don't have to download new ones. title: Spock's favorite puzzle pack
comment: Enough logic puzzles to satisfy a Vulcan, this is a nice collection of games. I play so often! There's a lot of customization of difficulty, & 0 ads. The translation from desktop controls to mobile handles occasionally awkwardly/clunky. My other qualms are picky, but Id love to see a score/ achievement system, itd add another level of compulsion to play. Interface is lacking in the beauty department, could benefit from some thoughtful minimalist design, but that doesn't bother me enough to drop any stars.
No ads, a few UI annoyances, tons of games, clear help files, cites his sources. This is probably the best game collection I could ever ask for. 10/10
Lots of puzzles. Chris you are amazing.

Update: Nice to have some new puzzles and the new features like zooming (which would make playing without a stylus easier). Unfortunately though, the newer versions have really made the responsiveness drop, things just dont run as smoothly. And when playing some of these puzzles for speed, it often misses quick taps or things like that. Still 5 stars because I love these puzzles, but I do mis the responsiveness of the old version.

title: Outstanding
comment: Great port of Simon Tatham's really intelligent puzzle collection.  These are entertaining as well as challenging.  This latest version has added some well thought out improvements to the interface improving the usability and overall experience.   Nice job!!

title: Great port of the BEST "pencil puzzle" collection.
comment: I have been playing Simon Tatham's collection on the PC for many, many years. I was thrilled to see it ported to Android. If you love Dell puzzle magazines, you will love this collection. There are no word puzzles, but there are just about every other type of puzzle you have ever seen in a newspaper or magazine (e.g. Sudoku), plus many other types as well, such as Minesweeper, Mastermind, Pegs (with random shaped boards), and many more.  All of the puzzles are completely randomly generated, so rather than buying a "Sudoku Collection" magazine, you have in this app an UNLIMITED collection of 36 different puzzle genres. All of the puzzles have many configuration options as well, so there are actually well over 100 ways to play. And of those many ways, you also have great control over the size and difficulty of each puzzle.  This port is a fine work in itself, and is actually easier to use in many ways than the PC version. For example, you can simply tap on icons in some games instead of remembering keyboard shortcuts.  NOTE: My initial review was for a buggy release, which was fixed within 24 hours, so Chris Boyle is to be highly commended for his responsiveness.
Thanks :-)

title: The best

comment: It's rare for any free app to ask for almost no permissions.  Even rarer for it to be a bunch of really good thinking games. This app gets it!

title: Amazing game collection
comment: This app is collection of best logic/puzzle games with all difficulty levels and types of these games possible and all this under 2mb. The only flaw is it doesn't have zoom facility. For eg if you choose a more difficult level of Loopy with many grids than it becomes impossible to play because number would be very tiny to be visible and even if you could see numbers than you won't be able to accurately put line where needed. Nevertheless a well deserved 5 star app.
You can now zoom. :-)

title: old but good
comment: came to know this game from my Linux experiance back in 2004, loving it sense...

title: Needs more Tapa!
comment: Love 9x9 unreasonable keen. Problem with latest update: stuck on the last game chosen, now I can only pay keen! Still the best game on my phone :)
Sorry about that - I believe this is fixed in the current version.

title: A must have for any puzzle lover
comment: The controls are a bit glocky, but it's worth it for so many puzzles games for free; without ads.

title: so addictive
comment: best set of games ever. all the brainy math-like ones.
Loads of fun! Great port over from the original!

title: Great port of the puzzle pack
comment: Only annoyance is the unfilled text in signposts, everything else is pretty well ported.
The unfilled text is fixed in the current version.

title: Single best puzzle collection in any form.
comment: Nothing comes close for this genre in apps, PC games, magazines, or books. Actually MORE than 34 different puzzle types, as many have multiple variations and difficulty levels. Nothing to buy, no ads, and an infinite supply of puzzles. The PC version currently has two additional puzzle types -- so make sure to get that as well. Wishlist: Nurikabe, Battleship, Easy as ABC, Kakuro.
The two new puzzles are now here as well.

title: Brilliant
comment: Great for train journeys

title: TITLE
comment: Awesome collection. Needs the option of zooming in on the bigger games for better accuracy, and need option to stop wrong answers turning red
In the current version you can zoom.

title: Favorite app
comment: This app proves that you don't need fancy graphics or high end processing power to create an amazing app. This is the best set of logic puzzles out there, and all for the low price of $0. I have only the highest of praises for this wonderful app. Simply spectacular.

title: Best puzzle app
comment: My favorite puzzles.

title: No bad ads like the other version in the Play Store
comment: Thank you to the devs for not having inappropriate ads that are not what I want my grandchildren to see.

title: No icon on Nexus 7
comment: Installed and uninstalled twice. This took several minutes to install both times. No icon appears after installation. I have plenty of free space on my device.

Sorry about that; I can only speculate that it's a Google Play issue rather than the app, as I've had no other reports of that? If the issue still occurs, you could perhaps try the APK at http://chris.boyle.name/projects/android-puzzles/

title: Brilliant
comment: The first app I download on any new phone

title: unbelievably good!
comment: i absolutely love this app.  it not only makes me think.  it also makes my kid want to think with me.  a buncha super interesting games.  what it lacks in good looks, it trumps in substance.  simply superb!  i thank you, kids.  well done!!  htc one 4.4

title: UI could use work.
comment: I absolutely love these games on the computer, but the Android UI could be better. It's very finicky and hard to change type.

title: One of
comment: The best puzzle game compilation ever!

title: Awesome puzzles, and no ads
comment: A great selection of puzzles to play, and each has multiple modes and sizes to challenge you in different ways.  There's no adverts, bloating graphics or anything - just a clean fast interface and good puzzles.

title: Excellent puzzle collection
comment: Outstanding collection of puzzle games, completely free, no ads either. Had something similar on iPod touch, been looking for something like it on android. Interface could be improved but its a minor gripe, everything is playable at least. Great app, recommended.
Best puzzles ever

title: User interface problems
comment: I have to delete all user data to change games.  The ui is very clunky.  The PC version is much better.
Sorry about that - I believe the inability to change games is fixed in the current version.

title: Great app
comment: Of course not really suited to phones, since this is just a port of a desktop application. Please remove the "designed for phones" label from the store page.  There are graphics bugs since my nexus 7 has been updated to kitkat.
The label is gone now that I've uploaded more screenshots, and the current version fixes various graphics glitches on Kitkat.
If you like to challenge your brain, you are in the right place.

title: Been looking for this
comment: I had this same app on my Palm M505!! Was disappointed to find the puzzle apps that existed when I got my first Android phone to be not nearly as good as this one. I have spent a lot of time trying to get my Android to do ALL the things I liked about my Palm, now it is finally complete.  Thank you!

title: Superb
comment: Crap presentation, but sheer variety of randomly generated games make this a must for puzzle nuts. No ads. Small size.

title: Makes u think
comment: Thank u for such a wonderful collection of puzzles
Great classics!

title: As advertised
comment: Bit clunky on the interface but delivers with a solid set of games.
Awesome collection of puzzles.  The interface is a little rough in parts, but this is still worth playing.

title: Love the puzzles, but...
comment: A lot of these puzzles are great, but this really needs to have a zooming ability.  Also, more explanation for the puzzles should be given.  While many of them are obvious, others that I have never even seen before can be hard to understand what some of the functions even are.
You can now zoom; also the documentation is now more prominently available.

title: Awesome!
comment: Love these games on Linux, now I love them PORTably.   Thank you!

title: Amazing
comment: One of the best free Android apps. I really like that this is one app, even though there are many different puzzles / games.

title: So many puzzles in one app!
comment: Awesome!

title: Best Puzzle Collection Period
comment: Best app for mind games and puzzles, huge variety, no frills.   I use it everyday on my commute.

title: Perfect, clever, fun for everyone
comment: No flashy graphics or sound track, just a long list of perfect puzzle games.  They all come with a variable difficulty setting for different ages and skill levels.  Fun for children and advanced puzzlers alike.  Too many great games to name.  I've played Simon's puzzle games on multiple platforms over the years and this is the best implementation.

title: Excellent
comment: Stable, lightweight, and just as fun as the computer version.  Thanks!  (P.S. Please add the new puzzle "undead")
I've added Undead. :-)

title: Wide variety of quality puzzle games.
comment: While I wouldn't use this for Sudoku as standalone Sudoku apps are better, the other puzzle games are very well done.
Mental Exercise Machine

title: This is a wonderful port!
comment: I've enjoyed Simon's puzzle collection for years. Whether you have two or twenty minutes to play, you'll find something here to entertain your brain. It's a very solid choice for logic puzzle fans.  This is an excellent port which adds a few interface tweaks to make the most out of the smart phone form factor. I haven't noticed any bugs. Thank you for porting it over.
Awesome

title: Longtime fan
comment: I've liked these puzzles for a long time and I'm glad I found them for Android.

title: Excellent collection
comment: This is a fantastic collection of puzzle and logic games, and completely advert free. I have a collection like this on my Nintendo DS too. It's rare to come across these golden applications in this modern day of adverts all over free stuff.

title: Good selection of puzzles
comment: Excellent variety. My favorite is rectangles, then untangle.

title: Excellent brain exercising puzzles
comment: What a great collection! No fancy graphics; instead, you get clutter-free presentation of a wide variety of logic-based puzzles.  Where applicable you can change the size/number of elements, and difficulty level. Each game has brief but thorough instruction. The icing on the cake is that it is free and there are no ads, but I would gladly pay for it if required. If I was only able to have one game app on my device, this is the one I would choose.
Good puzzles, but the Android app needs updating badly, as there are several new puzzles in the collection that simply aren't here.
The current version adds these puzzles.

title: Love it!
comment: played it first on my ubuntu laptop in 2009 and installed it since then on every linux system I installed. I'm so happy that it's available for android!

title: Entertaining
comment: Simple games that can entertain for as long as you need a little mental stimulation.

title: Highly recommended
comment: If you are looking for incredibly high replay and a wide variety of mind exercising games this is a wonderful collection.

title: Absolutely great set of games.
comment: Loved them in Ubuntu, love them in Android, even though some games are better suited for a mouse.

title: Best free game on Android!
comment: Enough said

title: Great fun
comment: Excellent little set of games, works very well for filling little bits of free time.

title: Buggy implementation of great games
comment: I love this collection on other platforms, and was delighted to see it on Android. Unfortunately, while a few play just fine, lots (rectangles, keen, untangle...) send the screen crazy on my Galaxy tab and are unplayable.
Sorry about that - this is hopefully fixed in the current version.

title: Great puzzles - however interface still needs some work
comment: The range and variety of puzzles along with the ability to customise your own size and complexity is fantastic. Unfortunately this is where the praise ends. It is obvious that these puzzle creative programs were designed for a computer rather than an android in regards to the fact no attempt has been made to make them android friendly. Here is what I would like to see in future updates: The ability to zoom in and out so as your screen size does not restrict you puzzle size; The ability to turn auto-check on and off; and finally get rid of the silly idea of holding down as an alternative to right clicking and instead offer an option to switch between drawing lines and marking blanks.   If this was all done than I would happily change my review to 5 stars. At the moment though I am getting too frustrated at the limitations for someone who likes large complex puzzles over the smaller ones.
Best games collection- ever!

title: Okay
comment: The puzzles are nice but I had to look all of them up to even understand what I was doing.
Best puzzle game ever! But it need better adaptation to  phone screen.

title: Fun Puzzles., high replay value
comment: I have been playing the different platform ports for years. I always come back for more.

title: Great games but not suited well to phones
comment: I really enjoy these games on a desktop but on a small screen it is often hard to use, especially for some games. A zoom feature would be very useful.
You can now zoom. :-)

title: Been a fan for ages
comment: Also had this on my Nokia N900 - this is exactly the same, except with more puzzles. Probably the most versatile game application I've had.  The only issue I have with it is that it doesn't work well on my phone with non-stock DPI

title: Yay
comment: Have this on puppy, now on Android too :) Go open-source :)

title: Hallelujah!
comment: Thanks for bringing one of my favorite iPhone games to Android!

title: Lots of engaging puzzles.
comment: Some may find the presentation a little plain, but I like it that way.

title: Hands down the best puzzle app
comment: These are *real* puzzles, not weak sauce toys that have to add a move limit to make them challenging. Logic and a lot of thinking are required here. Many different puzzle varieties, and randomly generated puzzles makes for infinite replayability. Some of the puzzle interfaces could be improved.

title: I can now uninstall 60% of the games on my phone!
comment: I have had these games on every computer since Simon made them available.  Thanks Chris for porting them to android.

title: Works surprisingly well on rooted Nook
comment: Fun to play, simple graphics so it's nice and speedy, and a great collection of puzzles.

title: Great puzzles but hard to operate on touch screen
comment: I love these puzzles and play them on PC too. Unfortunately many require tapping more precise than I can manage with fingers on my tablet.
You can now zoom.

title: Wow!!!
comment: I found this app by accident, while looking for a specific type of puzzle game...now, i can't stop playing these puzzles.

comment: The main downside is I sometimes forget the controls.. like how to switch to entering hints in Towers.

title: Awesome set
comment: I love these puzzles. Strongly recommended!
Love them

title: just super great
comment: simple. free. smooth. 34 great and classic games in one. 1.60 MBs  I mean you cant ask for anything better  This is better than all modern greedy ( full of ads )  games. seriously , great job.

title: Superb
comment: I have always liked Simon G. Tatham collection of puzzles, and I was delighted when I saw it ported to Android. They are great, and they work perfectly.

comment: Awesome collection of puzzles, my favorite is sign posts. =)

title: I love it
comment: Have played almost all puzzles to highest difficulty level

comment: It used to be great, but now it FC every time I try to open it.
Good stuff :)

title: my favorite time killer

title: Bad interface!

title: Best collection of puzzles

title: Great

Awesome

title: Awesome
comment: I played this  on my friends laptop after school it was awesome and he said there's an app for it
full of various puzzles!

title: Outstanding
comment: Nothing flashy, just the raw puzzles and some I had never seen before.  I've had it for months and I'm still learning new ones.  Nothing better for killing time on the airplane once they let you pull your phone out.  Found it first on Android, then went and installed on Ubuntu.  Open source license is much appreciated.

title: Nice work
comment: Simple UI to nice set of puzzles.Highly recommended.

title: Best game app
comment: All sorts of puzzles, including a sudoku clone that's better than any paid app. Free, no ads, no weird permissions.

title: Old Friend
comment: I have loved these puzzles for years on my laptop. What a pleasure it is to find them here for my new tablet. Addictive and highly recommended.

title: Fantastic
comment: Fantastic set of classic puzzles.

comment: loved these on my linux box, cool to see them here, now.

title: Has Black Box!
comment: Very cool that it has one of my favorite boardgames, Black Box, plus many others!!

title: Best puzzle game on Android
comment: This is a fantastic set of puzzles. Beats anything on the iPad. Almost all well-known logic puzzle types are represented somewhere within this set. I especially like Spiral Galaxies in this app.

title: Great App, Good Variety of Puzzles
comment: I had this on my Palm, and was glad to find it for Android when I switched phones. This is a great set of puzzles, including a number of Japanese ones by Nikoli (though some are under different names). Definitely recommended if you like logic puzzles, but touch controls can be tricky on some games.

title: Best puzzle collection around
comment: Ever since I discovered this brilliantly challenging compendium on the palm pilot it has been a mainstay on every pda/phone I've owned. Ridiculously simple looking but gives hours of fun.

title: Galaxy Tab 7.7
comment: lol only game app I need..

title: Love this app
comment: The Pattern game is both fun and addicting. However with the new update the numbers on the sides have become smaller and harder to read. If you could make them larger that would be great.

title: Random button?
comment: Why is there a random button underneath the puzzle? The button has an x on it and it doesn't do anything except waste screen space

title: Great collection of brain puzzles
comment: Great collection of brain puzzles. Been using them since my original droid days and if has worked great on  number of devices.

title: Awesome
comment: The perfect puzzle for a tablet.

title: Wonderful
comment: An excellent collection of small puzzles which can be played to kill a few minutes here and there. I've endured countless boring hours thanks to this game.

title: Great!
comment: No extra permissions, and has some awesome classics.

title: Awesome puzzles
comment: The best collection of puzzles available for computers.  Good for a 20 second micro break or a longer brain bender.   Hugely configurable for long lasting game play.  Great port, nice work.  Thanks SGT and thanks C Boyle.
Still the best puzzles on android.  Works on all my devices, with bigger and harder puzzle sizes for tablets.

title: Old familiar friend

title: Great Puzzle Collection!
comment: It's a huge selection of elegant, mind-bending puzzles, presented in a minimalist way.  I'm not sure what all the various icons are for, yet.  It works fine in landscape mode.  Some puzzles are familiar and traditional, some aren't.  There are many options within each puzzle type.  It's an amazing collection for free.

title: The best

comment: And the best of all is that they are open source under the MIT license.

title: Good puzzles. No frills.
comment: Love this. Variety of games in a single app. Some are easy enough for kids, others are hard enough for PhD. Warning: Turn on your brain. These are PUZZLES, not games.

title: Awesome time waster!
comment: Excellent puzzles.  Docs are good and the interface works surprisingly well, considering it is emulating a keyboard and mouse for controls (long-press for right-click).  Would be perfect with a zoom/pan view for puzzles with lots of small numbers onscreen, like sudoku.

title: Awesome!
comment: I've played these puzzles on four OS now.  Great design. Great implementation.  (Typo in Pearl help page)

title: Love these!

title: Been playing these for years...
comment: ...and now it's great to get to play on-the-go on my Android!  Need to add "Share" so you can send particularly fun/difficult seeds to your friends.  Five stars if you do.

title: Favorite puzzles on any platform
comment: I have used Sgt puzzles on my Nokia N800 and Debian Linux desktops, and the Android port is very well done: the puzzles are easier to play than my desktop version.  Great work!

title: Excellent free games
comment: Love this app. A couple of games are a little fiddly on a phone screen at high level of detail (15x15 galaxy), but more than enough work well to keep me occupied for hours.

title: The definitive time killer!
comment: I don't think I'd need any more casual games for a while...  Great app :)  I've spotted a problem though, that prevents me from awarding 5 stars... The colours chosen for the maps game are terrible for colourblind people! Replacing brown or green with blue would be perfect.
Inteligent and interesting

comment: Excellent collection of small size fun logic puzzles! Play well on phone. Nice additions for control. No ads added. Faithful & love that it's on my phone, so thank you!

comment: Nice to see this puzzle pack is available on Android. I discovered Simon Tatham's puzzle pack on Ubuntu - have since installed it on Windows, Symbian, and now Android too. Keep up the good work!

comment: If you have it installed on your phone, you will never know how the time flies by. It is best collection of different puzzles. Ask someone if you do not get how to play the game. It is easy.
